title: I am preparing for the JEE. Should I make notes or highlight the important things and methods on the book? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should make short notes for the exam. A simple reason is that you can’t carry those bulky books everywhere. But you can carry those notes and revise easily. Suppose you need to revise Rotational Dynamics, you found some good points from HCV, some good diagrams from DCP and tricks after solving questions from Test Series. You wouldn’t carry HCV, DCP and Test Series papers to revise just 2–3 concepts. Therefore if you make notes, you can easily revise stuff. Those notes should contain stuff which you forget easily or are very very important according to JEE.

Yes, You should ! 1.Make notes of each topic so that you don't have to study the entire topic at the last moment when you are revising at a fast pace 2.Also make an important Formula note book,Which you can see in the last 10 days of the exam.
